revised_title: Observations and Analysis of a Late Storm and its Phenomena
tldr: The author, William Derham, provides a detailed account of the atmospheric conditions leading up to a violent storm in November 1704. He also shares his observations of the storm's impact, including the saltiness of vegetation and the presence of sulfurous fumes in some areas. Derham suggests that the storm's intensity may have been influenced by a combination of wet and warm weather conditions, as well as the presence of nitro-sulphureous or other heterogeneous matter in the atmosphere.
